key_risks: Regulatory scrutiny from the New Zealand Commerce Commission impacting revenue models
Decline in copper network services requiring significant capital investment for fiber infrastructure
Market competition from emerging technologies and potential new entrants
Increased demand for high-speed internet due to COVID-19, necessitating rapid infrastructure expansion
controversies: Ongoing regulatory challenges affecting pricing and service standards
Stake reduction by Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group, potentially indicating a shift in investor confidence
social_issues: Balancing dividend payments with the need for reinvestment in infrastructure to maintain service quality
governance_issues: Proactive communication with shareholders on financial matters, demonstrating transparency
